intro: Andryala pinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leaved andryala, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features slender, pinnately divided leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Andryala pinnatifida is often found in dry, open habitats such as coastal cliffs and sandy soils.
